The Inverse Gaussian distribution

Source: R/dist_inverse_gaussian.R
dist_inverse_gaussian.Rd

dist_inverse_gaussian(mean, shape)

Arguments

mean

parameters. Must be strictly positive. Infinite values are supported.

shape

parameters. Must be strictly positive. Infinite values are supported.

See also

actuar::InverseGaussian

Examples

dist <- dist_inverse_gaussian(mean = c(1,1,1,3,3), shape = c(0.2, 1, 3, 0.2, 1))
dist
#> <distribution[5]>
#> [1] IG(1, 0.2) IG(1, 1)   IG(1, 3)   IG(3, 0.2) IG(3, 1)  

mean(dist)
#> [1] 1 1 1 3 3
variance(dist)
#> [1]   5.0000000   1.0000000   0.3333333 135.0000000  27.0000000
support(dist)
#> <support_region[5]>
#> [1] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf]
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 0.31675485 0.51615544 0.05485265 0.22744364 0.11985563 0.09944150
#>  [7] 0.08073795 0.16662449 0.23736976 3.40058962
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 2.6235168 1.0598113 0.1169017 0.3815840 0.3335922 0.3320627 0.5597577
#>  [8] 1.1470453 0.6815111 1.0636987
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] 1.4701508 1.0258227 1.2978997 0.6151251 0.5384944 1.5999303 0.4384491
#>  [8] 1.4052487 0.6145526 1.1164428
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1] 5.99449603 0.80870593 0.46849665 0.05292345 0.01654180 0.62662021
#>  [7] 0.18166915 0.10057529 0.09761984 0.11388125
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1]  3.5816292  0.4395504  6.6372307  1.8594419  1.1359534 27.8052432
#>  [7]  1.2574182  4.7173150  2.9178687  3.1586600
#> 

density(dist, 2)
#> [1] 0.06000195 0.10984782 0.11539974 0.06272885 0.13718333
density(dist, 2, log = TRUE)
#> [1] -2.813378 -2.208659 -2.159353 -2.768934 -1.986437

cdf(dist, 4)
#> [1] 0.9454196 0.9790764 0.9983186 0.8735512 0.8031695

quantile(dist, 0.7)
#> [1] 0.6758386 1.0851197 1.1505484 1.0143030 2.5216357
